meanings.definition: A breed of chicken known for its fluffy plumage.
meanings.sent1: The silkie chicken in our backyard has such soft feathers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a silkie at the farm with fluffy feathers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the silkie chicken bring a pillow to the coop? To make its feathers even softer!
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as fluffy as a silkie chicken's plumage.
meanings.sent5: The silkie's feathers looked like a cloud floating on the ground.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a soft, smooth texture.
meanings.sent1: She wore a silkie dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The silkie fabric felt gentle against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The silkie material was so smooth that it slipped through my fingers.
meanings.sent4: Her silkie scarf was like a gentle hug around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The silkie fabric shimmered in the sunlight, looking like a soft cloud.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at telling stories or jokes.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa is a silkie at family gatherings, always entertaining us with his tales.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was a true silkie, making everyone laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the silkie storyteller go to the library? To check out more jokes!
meanings.sent4: She weaved stories like a silkie weaves its feathers into a cozy nest.
meanings.sent5: The silkie of the group had everyone captivated with their humorous anecdotes.
